page.title: 11MACCLESFIELD CANAL
page.content: A major feature on our block is the Macclesfield Canal.The canal's use has changed from shipping coal to the wharves and TRANSPORTING goods for the various industries in the town.Now its major use is for RECREATION and barge holidays.Once a year a boat called the Mary Sunley,owned by the Macclesfield Voluntary Services,comes to Congleton. It brings old people down for a day trip and sometimes it brings disabled people who enjoy it very much.On the canal is a Snail Bridge_it is a squiggly shape and the path over it is cobbled.There are many fish in the canal and shrubs,hedges and trees growing by the side.When we walk along the canal we meet people fishing and sometimes we see people taking their dogs for walks.
